channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2023111205
item.description:
Report X-2023111205

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-17
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazardous materials staging area away from personnel and other packages. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was noted that the plastic bladder of isopropyl alcohol was ripped causing the contents to leak. The only packaging was an inner box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials drum awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023111186
item.description:
Report X-2023111186

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to us by the van line manager because of a bad smell. We discovered the can was bent/slightly crushed and all of the liquid had spilled out. The manager already had this in a tote but we made sure to secure this leaking package in a lined hazmat tote and moved to the hazmat cage, then placed it under the air vent. DescribePack: The lid was bent on top of the can DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We made sure to place this in a lined hazmat tote and went to the area where the manager discovered the leaking package to clean up the liquid on the ground.

item.title: Report X-2023111153
item.description:
Report X-2023111153

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought over to the QA department in a plastic tote for investigation. DescribePack: Upon investigation, one of the plastic gallon bottles had a loose cap and spilled inside of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a tote and brought to the QA for investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023111146
item.description:
Report X-2023111146

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered to be wet on the top side during the sort. It was taken to the nearest QA cage for further processing. DescribePack: the caps of all four inner bottles were loose. The top of the outer packaging was damp. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a red hazmat tote and taken to the hazmat cage for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2023111116
item.description:
Report X-2023111116

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered by a package handler to be wet on the top side, with the label soaked. It was set aside, and QA was informed of its condition and location. DescribePack: 2 jugs had loose caps/broken seals and were dented near the top of the neck. The outer packaging was soaked on the top side. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a red hazmat tote and taken to the nearest QA cage for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2023111097
item.description:
Report X-2023111097

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WE WERE CALLED TO THE IC BELT BY THE MANAGER BECAUSE OF A LEAKING PAIL. WE ARRIVED QUICKLY AND DISCOVERED A SMALL LEAK IN THE BOTTOM OF THE PAIL. WE ISOLATED THIS PAIL IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND MADE SURE TO GET THIS INTO THE HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: 1/4" HOLE ON BOTTOM OF PAIL DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WE PUT THIS IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND MOVED IT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023110779
item.description:
Report X-2023110779

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-04
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IC belt manager called QA on the radio about a wet hazmat package. We went over to inspect and discovered 1 gallon of this product spilled all of its contents inside of the package, contaminating the entire package. We isolated this package and moved to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: 1 loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Moved the package into the hazmat cage after placing it into a lined hazmat tote.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged hazmat was brought from unload area inside of a plastic bin. Package appeared saturated and torn. Package was secured in the Hazmat cage. DescribePack: One container appears to have spilled contents due to loose cap. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside of a plastic bin.

item.title: Report X-2023110690
item.description:
Report X-2023110690

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-01
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The events that lead to the actual damage of the package are unknown, but once package was discovered immediate action was taken to isolate the package in the Hazmat processing cage, where it could be further looked over and investigated. DescribePack: Package contained four one gallon bottles of corrosive liquid. One bottle had a broken safety seal on the bottle, which caused it to leak out into the carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once discovered, immediate action was taken to isolate the package in the Hazmat processing cage, away from the general area. Once inside the hazmat processing cage, the package was further looked over and processed thoroughly.

item.title: Report X-2023111039
item.description:
Report X-2023111039

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CALL WAS MADE TO THE DMP CAGE AOUT A LEAKING HAZMAT. DESIGNAED RESPONDER FOUND PACKAGE ON THE GROUND WITH 1 CORNER WET. WHEN RESPONDER OPENED PACKAGE, FOUND 4 INDIVIDUALLY BOXED 2.5 L CONTAINERS THAT EACH LEAKED FROM THE CLOSURES. FOLLOWING ALL PROPER RESPONDER METHODS. PACKAGE WAS SECURED AND REURNED TO THE DMP CAGE TO BE PROCESSED

DescribePack: Upon inspection it was noted that the cap on one of the plastic jugs of 70% Isopropyl Alcohol had come off causing the contents to spill. There was no packaging in the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials drum awaiting disposition.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: dropped, loose fitting and leaking wet pkg is the reason why this pkg failed DescribePack: Dropping hazmat caused liquid to escape from top DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Dropped pkg cause liquid to escape from pkg

item.title: Report X-2023110671
item.description:
Report X-2023110671

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-01
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS DISCOVERED UNDER THE BELT BY THE WORKAREA IT SHOULD HAVE WENT ON THIS MORNING. BOTTOM WAS RIPPED AND IT WAS IN BAD SHAPE. TOOK PACKAGE OFF THE BELTLINE AND SECURED TILL I WAS ABLE TO INVESTAGE IT FURTHER. DescribePack: CORNER OF 1 OF THE JUGS WAS DENTED AND AFTER SITTING THE JUG UPRIGHT THERE WAS A SLOW LEAK IN THE CONTAINER. SMALL PUNCTURE TO THE JUG. THE OTHER CONTAINERS WERE FINE. HOLE WAS VERY SMALL AND THE LEAK WAS JUST ENOUGH TO MAKE THE BOX UNDELIVERABLE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS SECURED AND CONTAINERS WERE PLACED IN A DIRECTION TO STOP FROM LEAKING FURTHER.

item.title: Report X-2023110620
item.description:
Report X-2023110620

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED AT QA AND THE BOTTOM WAS VISIBLEY WET ON ONE CORNER/BOTTOM OF BOX. WHEN PACKAGE WAS PLACED AT QA NO OTHER INFO WAS GIVEN TO ME REGARDIN HOW THIS HAPPENED OR WHEN. DescribePack: 1 OF THE 4 JUGS INSIDE THE BOX WAS PUNCTURED AT SOME POINT DURING THE SORT, CAUSING THE LIQUID TO LEAK OUT INTO BOX. VERY SMALL HOLE SO THE LEAK WAS A SLOW LEAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS SECURED AWAY FROM THE DOCK IN A YELLOW HAZMAT TUB AND INVESTIGATED AS DAMAGED. THE 1 JUG WAS PUT ON ITS SIDE TO PREVENT ANY MORE LIQUID LEAKING OUT.

Report X-2023110618

  • Description: SequenceEvent: dropped, loose fitting and leaking wet pkg is the reason why this pkg failed. DescribePack: dropping a hazmat caused the tops to loosen and this caused it to leak DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: When the hazmat was dropped this allowed the liquid to escape the container
